title: 112_s1154
content: The Act may be cited as the "Honoring Promises to Service-Disabled Veterans Act of 2011". Congress acknowledges the slow progress in meeting the Government-wide goal for service-disabled veterans and emphasizes the obligation of federal agencies and prime contractors to comply with the Veterans Entrepreneurship and Small Business Development Act of 1999. The public has a right to know if the goal is being met. SEC. 3. Transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Section 15 of the Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments are required to submit reports to the Administrator regarding the percentage of prime contracts awarded to these small businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to include transparency in contracting goals for small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. Executive departments must report on contracts awarded to these businesses, including subcontractor utilization goals and the percentage of subcontracts awarded to them. The Administrator will rank covered contractors based on their utilization of small business concerns owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator will rank Executive departments and covered contractors based on the percentage of contracts awarded to small businesses owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans. The Administrator will publish a user-friendly, electronically searchable report on a website containing information submitted by contractors owned and controlled by service-disabled veterans, along with rankings made by the Administrator. Publication may be exempted for national security reasons, and the report will be regularly updated. The Administrator will update the website with contractor information quarterly. An annual report to Congress will detail progress towards government-wide contracting goals, including the latest data and recommendations for outstanding contractors.
